newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: L&M seeks S$90.0 mln in rights issue plan.
newsitem.headline: L&M seeks S$90.0 mln in rights issue plan.

text.p: Construction company L&M Group Investments Ltd (L&M) unveiled plans on Tuesday for a one-for-one rights issue to raise Singapore $90.0 million.
The rights issue would see between 153.5 million and 191.6 million new ordinary shares of Singapore $0.50 each issued at S$0.60 for each rights share, L&M said in a statement.
It sid not say when the issue, to be lead managed by Nomura Singapore Ltd and DBS Bank Ltd, would be launched.
Money raised would be used to develop projects, reduce borrowings and increase working capital, L&M said.

About S$32.2 million would also be used to buy a 70 percent stake in PT Dharma Bhakti Jaya, an Indonesian company with a 21.8 hectare tract of land on which it plans to build resort quality bungalows and club house facilities.
All plans are subject to shareholder and regulatory approval, said L&M in a statement which accompanied its annual results for the year to December 31, 1996.
L&M reported a 21 percent fall in net profit to S$2.35 million from S$2.97 million in 1995.

The company said difficult trading conditions and the poor performance of some subsidiaries had prompted a restructuring programme resulting in an extraordinary charge of S$32.67 million for the year.
Prospects for 1997 were better though with the restructuring seeing the company poised to benefit from property and infrastructure development projects in the region, L&M said.
